channel.title: Favorite conversation?
channel.description:
What's you favorite conversation? It can be on skype or anything, and it doesn't have to have you in it.
Mine:
My dad: Hello? T-Mobile: Hello sir, what may I help you today? My dad: Uhh, I wanna find, uhh, where my, uhh, phone is. It's my daughters T-Mobile: Is it with you? There is one way but we have to register the phone. My dad: No, is there any other way? T-Mobile: No sir. My dad: But it is registered on my account why not? T-Mobile: We need verification. My dad: Why? T-Mobile: Uhh, we just do. My dad: Why? This is my daughter's phone on my account, why do you need a verification? T-Mobile: We need it, the government says. My dad: What the hell, I don't get it, why does it need verification? T-Mobile: Sir, we just do. My dad: *hangs up* Bullsh-t. Just bullsh-t. My mom: What happened? My dad: Nothing. Just f-cking T-Mobile with their stupid policies. Me *in my head*: What the hell just happened...

@davidi2 wrote:

Oh ok, well that was completely irrelevant still and not an actual conversation. Now I have to admit the rest of the thread is pretty spammy too, but I was just looking at reports. Sec I’ll give it a quick sweep

K cleaned. Also, you’re allowed to have fun, as long as your fun doesn’t involve making completely pointless posts to try and fit in!

item.title: Favorite conversation?
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

The reply itself was an unquoted quote that was part of a conversation IMO, this is how I sees it,

[quote=" reyx7, post:2, topic:445957"]Go to omeagle. Say f 16. When they ask for pics, post the jet.

[quote author=Skyro link=topic=548817.msg4025060#msg4025060 date=1340276325]
Lol, I’m trying it now…[/quote][/quote]

This thread was derailed on the third reply or so, I don’t think it was going to go anywhere unless a moderator cleaned it.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite conversation?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:17, topic:445957”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=548817.msg4027876#msg4027876 date=1340492835]

[quote author=Acorn_ link=topic=548817.msg4027874#msg4027874 date=1340492807]
silab can nuck my suts, how is it spamming if I said it one time and it pertained to the topic?
[/quote]How did it pertain to the topic?[/quote]
It was my favorite conversation as the subject of the discussion is favorite conversation.
I really don’t have a problem with it and I understand, I just feel like arguing today. I don’t see how multi quoting really causes an issue though if the thread is going no where, just lock it.[/quote]What conversation are you talking about?

And no, the point is the thread COULD be going somewhere, but spammers ruin it. If Yz85 hadn’t quoted the person above him, none of this would have happened. It’s what we like to call the blind leading the blind, but in this case he lead you all to infractions not off a cliff.

Read full topic

item.title: Favorite conversation?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

What’s you favorite conversation? It can be on skype or anything, and it doesn’t have to have you in it.

Mine:

My dad: Hello?
T-Mobile: Hello sir, what may I help you today?
My dad: Uhh, I wanna find, uhh, where my, uhh, phone is. It’s my daughters
T-Mobile: Is it with you? There is one way but we have to register the phone.
My dad: No, is there any other way?
T-Mobile: No sir.
My dad: But it is registered on my account why not?
T-Mobile: We need verification.
My dad: Why?
T-Mobile: Uhh, we just do.
My dad: Why? This is my daughter’s phone on my account, why do you need a verification?
T-Mobile: We need it, the government says.
My dad: What the hell, I don’t get it, why does it need verification?
T-Mobile: Sir, we just do.
My dad: hangs up Bullsh-t. Just bullsh-t.
My mom: What happened?
My dad: Nothing. Just f-cking T-Mobile with their stupid policies.
Me in my head: What the hell just happened…

Read full topic
